alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 11 at 12:14PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Cook. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations including viaducts and portions of roads is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated the heaviest rain had ended. However, between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flooding is expected to continue in the warned area due to runoff from earlier heavy rain and periods of additional rain. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Evanston, Skokie, Des Plaines, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Glenview, Ohare Airport, Park Ridge, Niles, Austin, Irving Park, West Town, South Lawndale, Lake View, Lincoln Park, West Ridge and Chicago Loop. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers, creeks, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Expect flooding of creeks, ditches, canals, and storm sewers, as well roadways, underpasses, and other poor drainage areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
